units.title: Day 5 medium change to FGF9/heparin
units.text: 26. Day 5: change the culture medium to E6-containing 200 ng/mL FGF9 and 1 µg/mL heparin (1mL/well), refreshing this medium every 2 d for a further 3 d (to D8 differentiation).
units.rationale: Introduces FGF9 and heparin to promote posterior intermediate mesoderm formation.

units.title: Day 8 switch to CDBLY2 medium
units.text: 28. Day 8: change the culture medium to CDBLY2 (1 mL per well), refreshing this medium daily for a further 5 d (to D13 differentiation) and monitoring the monolayer daily to ensure that there is no epithelialization of the culture (Fig. 2c, bottom).
units.rationale: Provides the nephron progenitor‑supportive CDBLY2 formulation to maintain metanephric identity.

units.title: Day 13 labeling of Transwell plates for organoid generation
units.text: 29. Day 13: on day 13 of monolayer differentiation, label the required number of six-well Transwell plates for organoid generation. If performing PT functionality assays and immunofluorescence outlined below, 2.5 Transwell plates will be required.
units.rationale: Pre‑marks plates to organize downstream organoid assays and imaging.

units.title: CHIR99021 pulse to micromasses
units.text: 45. Once all cell micromasses have been added to the membranes, perform a CHIR pulse by adding 1 mL of E6‑containing 5 µM CHIR99021 to the base of the Transwell and incubating the cell micromasses for precisely 1 h in the 37 °C incubator.
units.rationale: Temporarily activates canonical WNT signaling to drive nephron progenitor expansion.

units.title: Post‑pulse medium replacement with FGF9/heparin
units.text: 46. Following the CHIR pulse, replace the medium with E6 containing 200 ng/mL FGF9 and 1 µg/mL heparin to initiate organoid patterning.
units.rationale: Switches to growth factor conditions that promote metanephric mesenchyme patterning.

units.title: Albumin uptake assay – preparation of test and control tubes
units.text: 52. Day 27: prepare two 15 mL conical tubes for the ‘test’ (with albumin) and ‘control’ (without albumin) conditions, each containing 4 mL of E6 medium.
units.rationale: Sets up parallel conditions to assess megalin/cubilin‑mediated albumin uptake.

units.title: Albumin incubation of organoids
units.text: 56. Incubate the organoids overnight (~16–20 h) in a 37 °C incubator, during which time the DAPI uptake assay below (Steps 62–73) can be performed on the remaining six wells of live organoids in culture.
units.rationale: Allows sufficient time for fluorescent albumin to be internalized by functional PTs.

units.title: DAPI uptake assay – substrate and inhibitor preparation
units.text: 60. Prepare three 15 mL conical tubes for the ‘substrate’ (with DAPI), ‘inhibitor’ (cimetidine) and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ (DAPI + cimetidine) conditions, each containing 4 mL of E6 medium and 4 µL of DRAQ7 dead cell stain (1:1,000 dilution).
units.rationale: Creates the reagents needed to test organic cation transport and its inhibition.

units.title: DAPI uptake assay – incubation with inhibitor
units.text: 65. Incubate the organoids for 30 min in a 37 °C incubator.
units.rationale: Provides a short exposure to the inhibitor before adding the DAPI substrate.

units.title: Wholemount immunofluorescence – blocking step
units.text: 79. Replace the PBS with 200 µL per well of blocking solution and incubate on a rocking platform at 4 °C for 3–5 h.
units.rationale: Blocks nonspecific antibody binding to improve staining specificity.
